meanings.definition: A person or thing that removes the hulls from grains or seeds.
meanings.sent1: The hullers worked tirelessly to separate the husks from the rice grains.
meanings.sent2: Farmers use hullers to take off the tough outer coverings of seeds.
meanings.sent3: The hullers at the farm had a hullabaloo trying to get rid of all the hulls!
meanings.sent4: The hullers in the machine were like skilled surgeons delicately peeling away the outer layers.
meanings.sent5: The hullers whirred and clanked, transforming rough seeds into smooth grains.

meanings.sent1: The hullers gathered for a meeting to discuss their work in the fields.
meanings.sent2: I need to buy new hullers for the farm equipment.
meanings.sent3: The hullers lined up in a row, looking like a small army of seed removers.
meanings.sent4: The hullers on the shelf seemed to whisper stories of the grains they had cleaned.
meanings.sent5: The hullers rattled in unison, a chorus of efficiency in the barn.
